docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs

docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.
docs.title: Commands

docs.text: mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Project layout

docs.text: Custom plugin project structure ├── deploy.sh ├── mkdocs_plugin_include │ ├── __init__.py │ ├── plugin.py ├── README.md ├── requirements.txt ├── setup.py __init__.py # load class name `CodeInclude` into project namespace from .plugin import CodeInclude plugin.py override on_page_markdown setup.py # The following rows are important to register your plugin. # The format is "(plugin name) = (plugin folder):(class name)" # Without them, mkdocs will not be able to recognize it. entry_points={ 'mkdocs.plugins': [ 'code_include = mkdocs_plugin_include.plugin:CodeInclude' ] } usage Source file {{include("/home/user/projects/mkdocs-plugin-include/tests/test_file.txt")}} include in markdown part of source file between line 2-4 { {include("/home/user/projects/mkdocs-plugin-include/tests/test_file.txt",2,4)} } !!! warning Remove space between curly braces Result {{include("/home/user/projects/mkdocs-plugin-include/tests/test_file.txt",2,4)}} Resource hello-dolly-mkdocs-plugin mkdocs-plugin-template
docs.title: Custom plugin

docs.text: ├── deploy.sh ├── mkdocs_plugin_include │ ├── __init__.py │ ├── plugin.py ├── README.md ├── requirements.txt ├── setup.py
docs.title: project structure

docs.text: # load class name `CodeInclude` into project namespace from .plugin import CodeInclude
docs.title: __init__.py

docs.text: override on_page_markdown
docs.title: plugin.py

docs.text: # The following rows are important to register your plugin. # The format is "(plugin name) = (plugin folder):(class name)" # Without them, mkdocs will not be able to recognize it. entry_points={ 'mkdocs.plugins': [ 'code_include = mkdocs_plugin_include.plugin:CodeInclude' ] }
docs.title: setup.py

docs.text: source !!! Note Don't live empty line in the page tag header this plug in throw unhandled exceptions install pip install git+https://github.com/jldiaz/mkdocs-plugin-tags.git usages mkdocs.yaml plugins: - tags page Add to page header --- title: node template tags: - nodes - log ---
docs.title: Tags

docs.title: install

docs.text: plugins: - tags
